Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: Rmitch19
Reviews.Content: My friend and I just came home from a 3-night stay at the Wyndham Apollo hotel yesterday and both agree that it was absolutely wonderful! We booked the hotel on lastminute.com as one of their Top Secret hotel offers and in discovering the name of our accommodation were initially a bit worried after reading some very average reviews, however the Wyndham Apollo was an extremely pleasant surprise! It was a first time in Amsterdam for both of us and so we were slightly concerned that the hotel was a bit far from the city centre, however the reception staff were fantastic and provided us with a map and an explanation of where to find the nearest tram stop for trams 5 and 24 which would take us into the centre and back again. Our offer from lastminute.com was room only and we were very happy with this as there was both a petrol station and a supermarket nearby where we could purchase things for breakfast - our room was also supplied with tea and coffee making facilities! I absolutely loved this hotel and thought it was fantastic value for money; the decor is beautiful, particularly in the bar/lounge area and foyer. When we arrived we were very impressed with the look of the hotel, the efficiency and friendly nature of the staff and the fact that it even smelled wonderful! Our room was perfect - purple in colour, comfortable beds, clean sheets and towels every day and a spotlessly clean bathroom. We didn't have a view of the canals or marina but to us that didn't matter because we spent so much time walking around and seeing the sights of Amsterdam that we mainly used our room for sleeping, getting ready and then going again. We did spend one evening in the bar/lounge area before heading to our room and it was so lovely - very comfortable, warm and a fantastic, relaxing atmosphere. The hotel was not noisy or crowded despite having a car park full of cars. I would 100% definitely stay in this hotel again. It may appear to be quite a distance away from the centre of Amsterdam but it is so easy to get around using trams, plus the area in which the hotel is situated is absolutely lovely (lots of nice clothes shops for ladies, and also a wonderful Argentine restaurant called Gauchos which does excellent steaks). It is within walking distance to the Museum Quarter and it's also easy to get to and from the Schiphol airport - take the train from Schiphol to Zuid station and get the number 65 bus to Stadionweg and it's a 5 minute walk to the hotel door! Do not listen to the negative reviews about this hotel - I cannot fault my stay at all and honestly have no idea why so many people have complained, except that they just love a good moan! Thank you to Wyndham Apollo - you made our first trip to Amsterdam so perfect that we didn't want to leave and I will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Break”
Reviews.Author: Maire B Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Myself and my husband stayed in Wyndham Apollo Amsterdam from 30th March to 2nd April 2012. The hotel was easy to find - we got train from Airport to Central and just outside the door we met a Tourist information girl and asked what tram would we get. Number 5 we were told and hopped on and asked the driver to let us off at nearest stop to the Apollo. We found it easy enough and were delighted to find we had a beautiful room overlooking the canals. The hotel, although busy was very quiet. Breakfast was not included in our deal and at a price of â‚¬22.00 per person we declined. There is coffee/tea facilities in the room so we just bought rolls etc and had in room before we went out. We did have dinner in the hotel one night which Ienjoyed but my husband thought it was terrible and also very expensive. The hotel staff were very friendly but very slow on reception when checking out. Overall though the hotel was great and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant Stay, I will definetely come back.”
Reviews.Author: ericlautier
Reviews.Content: Our room was near the canal on the ground floor, (room 32) the room was very clean, and the bed comfortable, decoration is very nice with soft purple tone, and the whole standard of the hotel is high and decorated with taste with a nice restaurant breakfast room with view on canal,fitness facilities and even a smoking lounge nicely decorated. The only little drawback is the 10/15 min distance from the train station easily done with tram 5 or 24 though and at that affordable price no reason to complain.

Reviews.Title: “awful!!”
Reviews.Author: josephinegillan
Reviews.Content: after arriving at my hotel best western apollo museum hotel in amsterdam they told me they were fully booked and are going to send me to there neighbour hotel, wyndham apollo hotel. they were very helpful and put me straight in a taxi to the other hotel. when i arrived at wyndham apollo it looked very nice at reception and staff were very nice and pleasant. then i went to my room and found alot of dust in the room, such as the headboard. and on top of the bin and the sides in the room were all dusty, it was awful!! after a stressful day traveling i thought i would grab some food before bed only to find room service is not 24 hour i was very hungry and went to the desk and asked if they had a shop near by or a vending machine to get a snack they said all shops closed and no vending machines. so i then asked if there is anywhere in the hotel that i can get some water, the men at the desk said, well you have water in your mini bar. i said really? how much is it? the replied, 6euros fifty for a small bottle of water. i was really shocked and i just went to my room and looked in the mini bar only to find it completly empty. im very upset that the hotel did not organise the mini bar for me, that should have been done before i arrived! i was so thirsty and was not up for paying 6euros fifty for a small bottle of water so i just drank from the tap. im now in the room starving with no way of getting food. i just turned the lights off to go to sleep but could not because the room is rediculasly hot!! ive tryed to turn the aircon up and it does not seem to be working. im having a terrible night here, i honestly dont reccomend staying here. its NOT comforable at all!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Neither central or luxurious, stay somewhere other than the Wyndham Apollo”
Reviews.Author: Paula_8181
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in the summer of 2011 whilst on a short break to attend a concert in Amsterdam. The hotel had been advertised as central and modern, but in reality was neither. Luckily, two days before I had emailed the hotel to request a non-smoking room, only to be told that they did not have my reservation. After much panicking and email checking our room was re-booked - not a good start. Upon arrival (after a train and tram ride, followed by a 10 minute walk) we arrived at the hotel, which was by no means in the centre of things. The foyer and lobby area was well presented, and we were greeted by staff. Upon checking in to our room, we were asked for a 100 euro deposit as security for the room - given the short amount of time we were staying (2 nights) we didn't really have that amount of euros to spare, and had purposefully prepaid the room. I asked if I could leave 50 euros instead as I had no intention of using any of the mini bar/room services - the man at reception laughed at me and said I had to pay 100 euros. After much arguing we were allowed to leave a 50 euro deposit (which was then subject to 40 euros city tax which we thought was included in the room price). The room itself was tired and dated...we had been given a ground floor room which was basically part of the entrance, meaning we had to have the curtains drawn almost all the time so people couldn't look directly into our room. The beds were reasonably comfortable, and seemed to be clean - though the room did have a slightly damp/musty smell to it. For the price I paid, I would have expected either prime location, or a well appointed room - but I got neither. For the same price bracket I could have stayed somewhere considerably better right in the centre, which is why I'd advise other travellers to think twice.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at this hotel....”
Reviews.Author: Globetrotter201026
Reviews.Content: We both had a magnificent time in this hotel nicely tucked away in a quieter suberb of amsterdam but yet close enough to get a tram or taxi to anywhere or just to visit within the local area. The staff were charming and friendly and really couldnt seem to be helpful enough. The rooms decor is beautiful overlooking the canal making it a nice relaxing stay. The only complaint I would have is the pillows are not the best they are quite small and soft almost like cushions one would put on a sofa. That would be my one and only complaint though from staff to facilities this hotel is highly recommended for those who like their crewature comforts and dont want to be around the hussle bussle of city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Shame about the building works.”
Reviews.Author: kayteekitchendoor
Reviews.Content: We didn't eat in the hotel at all just slept and the rooms were very comfortable and clean. The only downside was that building work was going on and the view outside our window was a storage shed !! But we didn't raise the point with reception as we were really just sleeping in hotel after busy days visiting Amsterdam. We did have a few drinks in the bar which was lovely and comfortable....which was one of the reason's we didn't stay in the bar long...it would have been to easy to sit by the fire all evening and we had a full evening planned...lol... It was a great hotel about ten minute walk form tram drop off point...and night bus drop off...cost 13 euro's for a taxi from Central Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “So, there are big rooms in Holland after all!”
Reviews.Author: MPoloSolo
Reviews.Content: I am not sure why, but we have all been groomed to believe that most hotels in Holland are the size of the lovely miniature houses KLM distributes to their business class passengers in long haul flights. Crammed rooms, tortuous staircases, Lilliputian bathrooms and...the Dutch being Dutch and careful with their money...only one miniature soap bar for washing both hands and body...Enter the Wyndham Apollo in South Amsterdam, a short hop to Amsterdam South train station, 15 km from Schiphol and away from the red light district and its pink window displays...I came for a meeting there. Check-in a bit chaotic, with a huge group from a liquour conglomerate checking in at the same time and giving everyone the impression they arrived already intoxicated, such was the noise level. It always amazes me how corporate folks tend to get excited when they see each other in hotel lobbies, just minutes before they kill each other in interminable meetings just one floor up...Anyway, the receptionists were efficient, pleasant and even going out of their way to assist everyone. I was checked in by a great concierge, who could not find my reservation, but kept reassuring me there would be no problem. He gave me a nice room on the ground floor and that was just the beginning of a great stay. Nice view over a canal, very functional and modern room, good bed, nicely appointed bathroom (adult size and with two soap bars!), good size safe in the wardrobe, everything impeccably clean and in nice working order. Catering for the meeting I attended was very good, timely, different from day to day, no obvious recycling of buffet dishes, friendly and polite service. Check out was fast and efficient. Wifi throughout the hotel included in the meeting package and in perfect order. All in all a very good experience. Not a 5-star hotel in the sense of luxury or marble overdose. However, as a practical place for meetings or if you want a quiet place in Amsterdam, it is very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but very tired rooms”
Reviews.Author: FdV62
Reviews.Content: The hotel is centrally located in Amsterdam close to various business venues. The actual location on the crossing of some canals is quite idyllic giving a good Dutch feel. It is shame that a hotel in such a nice location is very mediocre in service and facilities. I spend my first of two nights in a room in the basement of the hotel just below the water level. Apart from it being claustrofobic, the room only had a bed that folds down from the wall (like the one used in comedies). As the hotel was fully booked, they could only offer me an alternative for the second night. When I return the next night, the access to my room was disabled requiring me to go back to the reception to find out that I had change rooms. I then had to go back to the old room again to get my luggage and find my way to the new, upgraded, room. This room was somewhat better, but still in need of refurbishment. One other thing that travellers to Amsterdam need to consider is the parking fees that hotels charge. This hotel charges about 30 euros per night for parking outside on their grounds.

Reviews.Title: “Ok business hotel”
Reviews.Author: D1P1
Reviews.Content: The room was good, bathroom easy very dated. service in the hotel was lovely and the food at breakfast and dinner was really nice. However the gym was appalling.

Reviews.Title: “Good option but be wary of expensive extras....”
Reviews.Author: FlanFam11
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel 4 times and find it a good option, being walking distance to the centre of town (25 mins) and close-ish to the airport (50 euro taxi). The location adjacent to 5 canals is very picturesque - the restaurants and some rooms overlook this. I would normally give this hotel 4 out of 5 as the rooms are clean and have everything required - however i did feel ripped off by some of the additional charges. Wifi was 50 Euros for 4 days! Luckily I checked before logging on so went for the 1 hour option - in a business hotel not to have access to free WiFi in some part of the hotel is really poor customer service. Travelling alone I often opt for room service, however at 10 Euro tray charge this made it a very expensive option. I decided to go for the Chefs Choice menu of 35 Euro in the main dining room. Food was excellent if a bit small in portion size! Cheese board was fantastic and had a choice of Dutch cheeses which were well explained. Breakfast is good - with the added entertainment of the breakfast waiters who have a good rapport going with both staff and customers. These guys actually made my stay! At the time of writing there were renovations underway - I was shown to a lovely room however the generator noise was like being on an aircraft so I asked to change. This was done with no hassle - however nobody offered to help me with my bags. The room I was shown to was definately quieter but of a lower standard than my initial room - which was a shame - but I accepted as it was quiet. There is a spa on site which I didnt use.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for RAI Convention!”
Reviews.Author: AndreasMam
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel among the crossing of 5 rivers, nice view from the cafe!! Relatively close to RAI center, either ultra cheap with taxi, or 15min foot. Mini-market next to the hotel (gas station)

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, but there are better options”
Reviews.Author: SimonMolloy
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 3 nights on business in December. It's a very comfortable hotel, with lovely beds and pillows, and a nice bar/lounge area that overlooks the water. It has a gym and more or less everything you could need to make your stay comfortable. The problem is that you have to pay a lot for these things. No free WIFI, in a business-orientated hotel? Really? Come on. The majority of people staying in the hotel are staying for business purposes and making them pay to use WIFI is just ridiculous. I wouldn't even mind if it was cheap, but it certainly isn't. Add to this the cost of breakfast, the cost of a drink, the cost of a movie, the cost of everything. It's a very expensive hotel. But if you can look beyond the cost, it's a very clean and comfortable hotel. It's a shame because something as simple as free WIFI can be the difference between me recommending this hotel and not.

Reviews.Title: “Great restaurant, great service”
Reviews.Author: Leiden_food_lover
Reviews.Content: I'm a member of CADS (the Commercial Anglo-Dutch Society), which has been meeting at this hotel every month for lunch for more than 10 years. In that time it has changed hands 3 times. As a couple we have stayed there overnight on a few occasions as well. The restaurant La Sirene is one of the best fish restaurants in the city, and the staff are without fail friendly, courteous and professional. The kitchen has a new young chef since last summer, and he is starting to show real potential in the kitchen. The outlook from the bar and terrace over the river is beautiful, and I use it as one of my favourite business lunch places. My only gripe is that the restaurant is closed on Sundays.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: SamehLabib
Reviews.Content: This hotel has perfect location as it is in a quite area but when you take tram 5 you can in every stop discover the famous attractions. The rooms are nice with canal view. The staff is very nice and helpful. The breakfast is great and the restaurant and bar are fantastic. It is very clean and if I. Go again to Amsterdam I will definitely stay in it.

Reviews.Title: “Near Exhibition Center RAI - false invoice”
Reviews.Author: J_Giese
Reviews.Content: I used the hotel for a business trip during EWEA. The hotel is not far away from RAI. Double Room used as Single Room. Prize: Expensive (but exhibition time) Nice lobby bar Attention: The hotel booked more money from credit card. No contact by email possible - contact adress on invoice false. No feedback by hotel

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay, unorthodox methods.”
Reviews.Author: richie m
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay. 2 nights over new years. The room was nice, not huge, but an extremely comfy bed and nicely decorate with a good bathroom. The staff were friendly and could all speak fluent english (as with most dutch folk), which was a massive help. Buy a 24hour tram ticket and scan the ticket as you get on and off the tram - this was new to me but works very well. Our room wasn't ready till 3pm. We arrived at 11am. The hotel looked after our baggage as we dragged our travel tired feet around to local spots. Room service is pretty pricey. 21 euros for a burger than is nothing to write home about. We ate in the 'Marina Lounge' as the restaurant was closed during New Year (a LOT of restaurants were). The food was really really good. But the service was slow and took too long to clear our plates. The bar doesn't offer much of a variety of drinks. The staff at the front desk are very helpful if you need anything - taxi's, restaurant bookings etc. HOWEVER, MASSIVE 'guarantee' amounts taken from my card during my stay. That are going to take days to come back to me. This is quite unusual to me as the amounts are very large.

Reviews.Title: “Could be so much better”
Reviews.Author: Rob H
Reviews.Content: The best part of this hotel is the bed - very comfortable which is so important to me. We had a suite so not sure if all the beds are the same. Apart from that the hotel was very average and I did expect better. We have family that live very close by so an ideal place for us to stay. Cost of breakfast and other services are high. I thought the service did let it down and we had to ask for coffee and tea for the room as it was not set out. There were no saches for the coffee machine and it was not particularly clean. It's a pity that it does not seem to be well managed because it has the potential of being very good. We probably will stay there again but only because it is so convenient for visiting our family.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, cold and plain horrible”
Reviews.Author: Mst_Malik
Reviews.Content: The room had serious heating issues as it was freezing due to the window not closing properly, I didn't sleep a wink due to the wind noise Unfortunately I was there for three nights The curtains were dirty The bathroom was untidy and had mould The bath was filthy Just look at the photos and judge for yourself. Location is cool, staff are nice, my room was just horrible

Reviews.Title: “We had a wonderfull stay!”
Reviews.Author: MvT188590
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend had a excellent stay in the Wyndham Apollo Hotel in Amsterdam. When we arrived, the room wasn't clean yet (no worries, because it was 11.45 am) so our bags where placed in the storeroom (free of charges), we took the Vespa of the hotel and went into the city centre. The Vespa was a lot of fun and easy to use in the busy city centre. After a long day of sightseeing, we arrived back in the hotel and our room was ready. The room was nice, dark purple colours, soft beds and great canal view. Even the ordered bottle of champagne was in the room, together with 2 champagne glasses. It was just great to see that the staff took the effort to make our stay as comfortable as possible. After freshing up, we had a marvellous dinner in the restaurant. The food was amazing, the wines were great and there was a nice and warm atmosphere in the restaurant. Even the restaurant supervisor Tim was very passionate about his job and showed a great feeling of hospitality. The check out went quickly and the staff was very friendly and welcoming! We had a AMAZING stay and we will definately come back!

Reviews.Title: “Tired rooms, a bit far from the centre but good service and comfortable bed”
Reviews.Author: EllaMLondon
Reviews.Content: It was a weekend booked via lastminute.com and it was literally a last minute booking. The hotel is quite far from the city centre (25mins or so by tram, 10mins from the museums quarter). The neighbourhood of the hotel is nice, quiet and safe but it does cost 15 euros to get to/from the city centre (at night time when there is no public transport). The hotel has a nice exterior and reception but our deluxe room was tired, with patches of torn carpet, very outdated bathroom that must be a struggle to keep clean and shiny (so it was not shiny at all, although it was not dirty, just very tired-looking, e.g. acrylic bathtub past it use-by date, permanent stains on the marble, etc). It was kind of a room where you do not want to walk barefoot on the carpet and you do get the urge (at least i did) to wash your hands from time to time. Once again, I do think it is clean enough there, just not easy to maintain the sparkly clean look in a well worn-out place.The bed was very comfortable, long and wide, and not too firm. The staff at the reception was quite responsive, esp. the concierge, and whilst I don't consider it extraordinary, it was nice. The thing we appreciated was the opportunity to get the tickets to Van Gogh museum right before heading there - with no premium charged.... We did not try the breakfast given previous reviews, plus there are a couple of bakeries next to the tramline where you can have a nice continental breakfast...Overall, I have no complaints about the hotel but i think it should not be advertised as "top hotel" by lastminute, so my grudges are to lastminute.com, not to Wyndham. I also think that for the rate which is 15% lower than the rack rate, there should be something either more central or, if a bit out of the way, in a better condition than this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly and lovely location!!”
Reviews.Author: Alexjhill
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel over the weekend of 11th - 13th Nov - the hotels in Amsterdam were very busy over this weekend as Sinterklaas was arriving in Amsterdam on the 13th. So my girlfriend booked our hotel via lastminute.com as a secret hotel (this was a surprise for me as we have just got engaged). We got to the hotel early, around 10am and were told a room wasnt available, which we expected and was fine. Our luggage was put in the hold room and we went off into town. The tram stop is around 5 mins (max) away from the hotel and we were waiting no longer than 3 minutes at any time for a tram. The trams take less than 10 minutes to get into the town and you get to see some of the outskirts of Amsterdam, which are lovely. If we stayed in the centre we would have never seen De Pijp, which is a very cool area with bars, cafes, a street market etc. So the tram and distance is no real issue at all unless you enjoy whinging and need to find something to whinge about. After a lovely day in Amsterdam we returned around 6pm. We had a lovely room on the 6th floor overlooking the canal junction. There was also a complimentary bottle of Prosecco to congratulate us on our engagement - a very nice touch. We checked in with a lady called Rosana (i think!) who was very nice. The room was lovely, spacious and clean. Before knowing there was a bottle of Prosecco in our room we had bought a bottle ourselves to have in the room while getting ready - so on our way up to the room for the first time we went into the bar and asked for an ice bucket and glasses - which were given to us with a smile. We also asked for some cutulery one night and this was no problem as well. During the stay the toiletries were replenished each day, the towels were changed, the bed was made- excellent service. I would agree the tax needs to be mentioned on arrival or even taken on arrival - it was a shock to us as well when we were leaving. Overall we were very happy with the hotel and location. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “More Expensive Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: YorkshiremanBrussels
Reviews.Content: The hotel is fine with good sized rooms, though mine had a panoramic view of the car park. Little walk to some local restaurants. We had booked the room but no breakfast. Next morning my colleague and I decided to have the buffet breakfast which was advertised at Euro 17.50. When we checked out we discovered that we had been charged Euro 22.50. When I questioned this, they told me it was more expensive as we had not ordered it the night before when checking in. I pointed out that it was a BUFFET breakfast and that no pre-preparation was necessary. The receptionist was quite cold about it with a "tough - you did not order the night before (nor did we explain the system the night before either)" attitude. She handed me my bill very determinedly with a "no arguments" look. I dropped an e-mail to the manager and he too was unrepentant (but offered me an upgrade the next time). Not really a question of money, more a "we don't explain the system then we charge you extra" principal. It would have been easier for them to just back off and give two potentially regular customers the lower price. But no....

Reviews.Title: “You don't get much for your money.”
Reviews.Author: Susan W
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as it was bought through lastminute.com - and it was disappointing. Would make me reconsider using lastminute again. First, it's only 'close' to the museum district. And Amsterdam is so small, that means the hotel is halfway between the centre and the airport! For this price - you'd expect something closer. Once you've factored in tram fares/travel times, it's not a bargain. Plus, as trams stop at midnight you've also got to factor in taxis - which are about 10-15euro from town. So it all adds up! The actual hotel is fine. Though the picture is massively deceptive. It's in the suburbs, and the view isn't nearly that great. We got a ground floor room looking onto the carpark - nice. The rooms are clean, but they aren't into details. There were two of us in the room - and they didn't leave enough glasses/mugs for us both! For 100e a night I'd like a glass each! And they don't restock the toiliteries during your stay. So when you run out of their tiny bottles of shampoo, you might have a problem. Checkin/out was a hassle. Checking in - had to wait ages for the receptionist to get off the phone. She also forgot to mention the room tax we'd have to pay when we left- not so professional. Check out - there was a massive queue. Waiting in it really messed up our last morning in the city. For such a soul-less and corporate hotel - you'd have thought they'd discovered express checkouts! In short, this place if fine, if you're not after frills or a warm and pleasant experience. But - if you have time, it's definitely worth finding somewhere else more central/better value for your money. the city has plenty of options.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Restuarant”
Reviews.Author: Basrat99
Reviews.Content: Having tried a variety of hotels in Amsterdam over the past 10 years for business this is my favourite. Rooms and clean, quiet and very modern. The hotel is on the confluence of 3 canals which means that most of the rooms have waterside views. Be careful when checking in not to get a lower floor room on the side that looks towards the sports centre next door however - my last visit I just had a view of a brick wall about 10 feet away from the window. Every other room I have stayed in has had a great view. The food in the bar is very good, whilst that in the restaurant is superb (as is the service). Check in and out is usually very quick and the staff are helpful and friendly. Special mention to the conceirge who always does a great job. Location is good - short walk from tram stops (5 mins), restaurants (5-10mins), Leidseplein (10-15mins)

Reviews.Title: “avoid this hotel at all cost!”
Reviews.Author: fugly t
Reviews.Content: Horrific hotel staff! I specifically requested canal view but the hamid zeroual (or something like that) gave me an annoyed look like I dont deserve a canal view, he gave me a room with a lousy view! i was 4th in the queue to check-in, I saw his super nice smile and greeting the 3 caucasians ahead of me, but when its finally my turn, he asked me to wait, while he grab coffee, chit chat with his colleagues, answers phone calls, while I wait for him to check me in, he never smiled or greet me while serving me, very nice... but worst, the aircon in my room is not working, its bloody warm in my room, it was warmer outside, then I complained to hamid and he shut me off, he said the aircon is working, until I told him to come to feel for himself, he didnt come, someone other staff came and notice it was really warm, so they gave me a new room... this hotel is a real nightmare, especially for asians!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, a bit out of town though”
Reviews.Author: BecciLouise1985
Reviews.Content: I wouldn't mark this down for being a little out of town, because it's only 5â‚¬ for a taxi right into the centre, or a nice walk! Really nice place, i'd stay here again. Bedroom was very clean, with a nice large balcony. We had a few friends over from another hotel to get ready for a night out over in the arena and they were fine with 13 people coming to our rooms for drinks, abnd even bought us up ice! The reception was rather hot, but the rest of the hotel was air conditioned. We did not eat in the restaurant, it looked very nice but a little pricey- but fitting for the quality of hotel! Lovely seating area out on the canal for food and drinks.

Reviews.Title: “we love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sittipunt
Reviews.Content: We have spent 4 nights in Amsterdam staying at Wyndham Apollo hotel. We really like this hotel. Its locates in a nicer part of Amsterdam with easy access to central area by tram (just 5 minutes walk away) The area around hotel is very nice and it is just a short walk from conference center with many nice restaurants and shops. We rented bicycles from the hotels and really had an excellent time. The staffs were very nice and helpful, we arrived early (8 am) from Thailand and they managed to find a room for early chek in for us. The breaskfast is also very nice. We would recommend rooms with a canal view if possible. It is really nice and view from our room (116) is one of the best view we have experience during our trip. C. Sittipunt Bangkok Thailand

Reviews.Title: “Stay away!”
Reviews.Author: SamMaes
Reviews.Content: Terrible hotel that doesn't match pictures and description from the website/booking.com. Rooms are really dirty and smelly. Staff is really unfriendly and not helpful.

Reviews.Title: “2.5* rooms at 4* prices”
Reviews.Author: ClaretRuss
Reviews.Content: This hotel advertises itself as 4*. The lobby and communal areas certainly live up to that standard, as from our experience did the friendly staff. Unfortunately, some of the bedrooms don't come close. I understand that the hotel is part way through refurbishing it's bedrooms - but it is certainly misleading to sell a 4* hotel and provide a bedroom that is 3* at best. I booked this as a Secret Hotel deal through Lastminute.com and so had no way of choosing the bedroom in advance, or I might have been able to avoid this pitfall. Our room had a threadbare carpet with several holes, wallpaper that was peeling from the wall, curtains that didn't close properly, a poorly designed bathroom with an extractor fan that didn't work, plumbing that sounded like somebody knocking on the door whenever water was running in adjoining rooms - in short, it just wasn't up to 4* standard. It was reasonably sized & provided all the basic facilities that you would expect - but it was simply outdated and in desperate need of refurbishing. We only stayed for 2 nights, and used the hotel purely as somewhere to sleep, so it didn't detract from our stay as much as it would with others who spend more time at a hotel. However I would be very wary of booking this hotel if you are looking for guaranteed 4* quality, because despite paying for it you might not get it.

Reviews.Title: “Better than ecpected”
Reviews.Author: idyc
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as a secret hotel so got a good price for it. After reading on tripadvisor quite a few bad reviews about this hotel, I arrived with low expectations. We had phoned in advance to check that the hotel have received our reservation and also asked if we could have a refurbished room. We were told this would be at the cost of 25 euros per night. We decided against this. The hotel was easy to get to. We decided to get the train from the airport to Amsterdam Zuid (south) station and then the no.65 bus which took us 1 minute walk from the hotel. Check in was at 3pm, and as we had arrived at 10am, we were able to leave our luggage in the hotel's storage room in order to explore the surrounding area. At check in, we asked again if we could have a refurbished room, and we received the same answer of 25 euros per night. Upon returning, we went to the reception to pick up our room key card, and was surprised to find that we had been upgraded to an executive room with a canal view! The room was clean, bed was large and comfortable, bathroom had speakers so that you can listen to the tv or the radio, the view was very nice, facing the Marina. It would have been nice to have a full length mirror in the room though. The tram stop for the trams 5 and 24 is about 5 mins walk from the hotel. The tram stop is also at the top of Beethoven straat, which has a few restaurants and shops. Otherwise, both trams go towards central station and dam square via different routes. The last tram is around midnight. We had one meal in the hotel as it was pouring with rain. Mussels and frites was about â‚¬20, and that was a promotion and a hot chocolate is â‚¬4!!! food and drink in Amsterdam is very expensive! I was happy this secret hotel turned out better than expected! I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price”
Reviews.Author: Finem50
Reviews.Content: Amsterdam, like London and New York, present difficult hotel choices. The great hotels are outstanding, almost everything else isn't. Traveling with an orchestra means the luxury hotels are out of the question: finding something acceptable for one or two nights is more difficult. The Wyndham is well-located, especially for musicians and music-lovers: its a 10-15 minute walk to the Concertgebouw but for those otherwise inclined, to the Museumplein. It is reasonably clean with smallish rooms and not the most comfortable beds. Bring ear-plugs as the rooms as not well insulated and the hallways quite noisy as people come and go. At breakfast, I was shooed away from a table with more seats than I intended to occupy. I'm used to the occasional brusqueness in the Netherlands and the breakfast was good. I wouldn't choose to stay here if I returned on my own as a tourist but if you want to see the city, hear a concert or visit a museum, budget is a factor and you don't plan to spend much time in the hotel, it's not a bad choice. Believe me, I've stayed in worse in this particular city!

Reviews.Title: “Pros and cons, but we'll pick a different place next time.”
Reviews.Author: GSKorelys
Reviews.Content: Good - the staff was fantastic. They were always helpful and courteous, no matter who we dealt with or at what time of the day. They even allowed a very early (10am) check-in with no problem or fuss at all. The bed was extremely comfortable and the view from our city-view window was great. Coffee and tea included in the room was also very nice. Bad - the room smelled like smoke, despite being a nonsmoking room. It has obviously been smoking in the past and they didn't clean it out very well. The wallpaper had numerous holes and tears, the carpet was peeling up at a few of the corners, and the wooden furniture had scrapes that were so deep they showed raw wood. The bathroom was fine, except that it was literally impossible to shower without getting water everywhere (one of those silly Euro tub/shower combos with the glass door that doesn't reach the edge of the tub or extend the length of the tub). The plumbing is obviously old, as the pipes sang to us every time we turned on the water, showered, or flushed. The bottled bathroom products left (body peel mask, lotion, and shampoo) were all half-empty -- I guess the last guests left them behind and housekeeping figured we could use what was left. I didn't want to use a stranger's product so we left them alone. Wifi is 12,50 Euro for 24 hours, and when free wifi is standard, I find this to be quite steep. The desk agent at check-in was excited to tell us about their "August Special" of 12 Euro/person breakfast room service, but when we viewed the menu in our room, we saw that they also charge 10 Euro per person for all room service orders! Another plus is that the area was really nice. It's a very quiet residential area with a short walk to the number 5/24 tram that takes you into the center of Amsterdam within 15 minutes, with a lot of good stops along the way (street market, museum quarter, etc).

Reviews.Title: “Appauling”
Reviews.Author: Tinyhuman85
Reviews.Content: Myself and a friend stayed at this hotel back in April and since our visit I have had my credit card consistently debited every month since leaving. The first charge was for Â£7 which apparently was for the mini bar (we did not take anything from the mini bar) the second charge was for Â£65 which I disputed and was told it was for "stamps" for my friend's toothbrush to be sent back to the UK. My friend told me he had asked for his toothbrush to be sent back but has never received it. He provided them with his credit card details so they could charge this to HIS card. I have email proof of this yet they still charged it to MY credit card with no authorisation. Â£65 for a toothbrush to be sent back to the UK is ridiculous and he was never told how much this was going to cost before they sent it. So then when on the 3rd August last week I was charged another Â£52 you can imagine my utter disbelief. I called the hotel to find this charge was for the toothbrush to be sent back to Amsterdam because they were unable to deliver the item. No delivery note was received by my friend to suggest that they had attempted any delivery. The reason stated on the Fedex account is because he has no postbox (we definitely have a postbox!) They would not refund me the money unless I provided my friends credit card details which i obviously do not have. Completely unfair and unreasonable. I am shocked at the incompetence and how much a toothbrush costs to be fedexed to the UK!!! Will never visit here ever again and unless you want your credit cards to be consistently debited with no authorisation from you for months after you have left I suggest you stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Roland M
Reviews.Content: We were transferred here after a double-booking at the Museum Apollo and the staff were very helpful and gave us a lovely room overlooking the Marina. Staff were friendly and helpful at all times. Only criticism was the ill-fitting shower screen in the bathroom which meant that the floor flooded every time we used the shower.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty terrible service, and the hotel wasn't far behind - hidden costs.”
Reviews.Author: Paula6585
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel through Lastminute.com as a 'top secret hotel' (supposedly a 'luxury hotel at a fraction of the price') as it advised it was close to museum quarter. First issue was that the hotel didnt have our booking - i had emailed 3 days before we left for amsterdam to request a twin room, only for then to reply 2 full days later to say they didn't even have a reservation for us. After a lengthy call with Lastminute this was sorted out, but dread to think how it would have been resolved had we arrived in amsterdam with no reservation. When we did finally arrive at the hotel a train, a tram, and a shortwalk later we realised it wasn't really that close to anything. Initial impression of the hotel was that it was well decorated and very nice in the entrance - upon check in we were informed they needed a 50 euros per night deposit, meaning we had to part with 100 euros before our holiday had even begun - worth taking note of if staying for more than a couple of days as some other guests were caught short after being asked to pay 300 euros on arrival despite the room being prepaid. The room itself was pretty dated, though clean, and the beds reasonably comfortable. A drawback however was definitely that the view from our room was the entrance foyer (described as 'city view) meaning we couldn't see very much of anything except people walking past - and worse still, they could look directly into our room. The stay itself was fairly uneventful and we had no problems until check out - where they deducted city tax from our deposit (Which we were told we'd get back) which we though had been included in the price as there was no mention of it being an additional cost (as some hotels make a point of saying when booking). I wouldn't really recommend this hotel at all, as it doesn't have much going for it - pay a bit extra for city centre and you'll save on travel costs anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Val12345
Reviews.Content: Great, swanky room (we got one overlooking where the 5 canals meet at the back of the hotel and it was a very pretty view), spotlessly clean, great service - one of the guys at reception directed us to a laundry outside the hotel (much much cheaper!) and called ahead for us to check they would "wash dry and fold" our clothes. Brilliant, friendly service. The hotel is about a 1hr walk to the central station but there is a tram stop about 5 mins walk away (tram 5) buti it is closer (about 20mins walk) to the museums and Liedesplein. It is a lovely walk along the canals during the day and at night, if you fancy it though. We chose this hotel from a top secret type deal and we were very impressed.

Reviews.Title: “A bit jaded”
Reviews.Author: les_mac62
Reviews.Content: This hotel was ideally situated for us as we were travelling with a car (Euros 30 per day)and it was just off the A10 ring road. It was a 5-10 min walk to the nearest tram stop (5 or 24) into Amsterdam. The hotel itself was comfortable but our room could have done with redecorating as the carpet was threadbare in a few places and the bathroom needed updating. The bed was comfortable and the staff were helpful putting in an extra bed for our teenage son. We bought a day (24hr) card for the trams which proved useful. We had asked for a canal view room but unfortunately we got a city view room which looked onto the car park.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Peaceful part of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: chrisNchris
Reviews.Content: This is a most pleasant hotel - breakfast on the terrace overlooking the junction of 5 canals is a rather unhurried and relaxing affair with plenty to eat from the breakfast buffet. The hotel has a nice restaurant and one evening my wife and I decided to have the set 3 course menu, the chef sent out a few little extra things along the way and I must say everything was presented very well and tasted delicious. I would recommend that you eat inside - smokers in Holland are just as inconsiderate as smokers everywhere else and if you are a non-smoker you stand a good chance of having someone light up because they have just finished their meal even though you may just be starting yours. Holland has adopted the same type of legislation as the UK in regards to smoking inside public buildings, so "inside" is smoke free. The room we were allocated did need some redecoration but this is true of almost every hotel in the world unless its in the first 12 months of being open. The constant 24 hour stream of human traffic takes it toll on any hotel. Do ask for a refurbished room as the hotel is in a cycle of refurbishment, but our room was clean and they serviced it whilst we were at breakfast. The hotel staff were friendly and very helpful - I even got a knock on the door one evening by the desk staff to make sure that everything was OK and that my request had been dealt with to my satisfaction. (I had asked about booking breakfast as I had not done this at the time of my original booking). To get into Amsterdam Central take the 24 or 5 Tram. These are accessed from the tram stops by coming out of the hotel and taking a walk of no more than 5 minutes down towards the end of Gerrit van der Veerstraat. When you come to the junction look to the right and you will see the Tram Stop in the central reservation. The ride to the centre of Amsterdam will take no more than 7 - 8 minutes. The tram numbers are on little cards on one end of the tram stop about 7ft up towards the roof covering. If you want to to be able to pronounce your street names and to be able to read them easily - stay at home - forget the rest of the world exists and don't ever try to have a sense of adventure. If you have a nokia phone use the free OVI GPS mapping system to navigate yourself around. You can leave the application on all day (like I did on my C5-00) without any perceptible battery drain! Simple and outstandingly effective. Whilst I have read some of the comments about this hotel, there is little I can identify with - there will always be the professional moaners who insist the hotel is a waste of time because a small bar of soap was unavailable on the day they arrived or that car parking was expensive (Try Statford-upon-Avon in the UK - its the place where Shakespeare was born - the Multi Storey car park there is Â£5.50 an hour =150 euros a day). If you really need and demand 5* service (or you have a 5* attitude) - go to a 5* hotel and pay the appropriate rate. I would stay here again and look forward to doing so - its peaceful, well away from the stag and hen parties in Amsterdam central, the rooms are clean, you get a good nights sleep on comfortable beds, the food is good and the staff are friendly and helpful. What more do you want? Oh - one more thing. If arriving by train from Schipol Airport - don't go to central and then tram it or bus it - instead go to Amsterdam Station Zuid. This is just 10 minutes walk by coming out onto Minervalaan then onto Stadionkade and from there straight onto Bernard Zweerskade. Keep going and you will walk onto Apollolaan - you will be able to see the Hotel - this street currently has some very strange sculptures along its route, most entertaining. OR take a 24 Tram.

Reviews.Title: “There's no way this is a 4 star hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: marisafoord
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on Lastminute.com through the TopSecret hotel option. Firstly, it is very far out of Amsterdam. Quite a pretty hotel on the inside, and the room was quite big. However, everything else was really terrible. Firstly, the renovation that was done to the room were very poorly done. Upon arrival, we did not receive soap (although it said complimentary and included) and only half a toilet roll. After a few days, when the toilet paper ran out, we actually had to request more toiletpaper and soap, as this was not provided. The service we provided were also not very friendly or helpful (except the check in lady on the first day). We could hear everything from the room next to us. Also, wifi / internet / tv and parking is EXTREMELY EXPENSIve (Â£30 for Internet a day). For four star and the price, this is definitely not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff, clean room, great parking rate”
Reviews.Author: asokolove
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for one night, no children. Great staff, clean comfortable room and parking the car only cost 30 euro for 24 hours. In Amsterdam, that's a good deal!

Reviews.Title: “good location right next to a canal”
Reviews.Author: m_and_k_in_munich
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel last minute for a business trip. The stay there was fine. Positives include the terrace looking out onto the canal, great for breakfast and evening drinks. Staff also generally polite. Downsides were the internet which kept disconnexting making it impossible to connect to work emails, and the fact that the showers did't work on my last day there (a problem which affected all rooms on my floor). Not a good start to the day...

Reviews.Title: “A must for those who don't enjoy staying in Hostels”
Reviews.Author: jmattgardner
Reviews.Content: Many tourists who travel to Amsterdam will choose to stay in a hostel. Perhaps they're looking for a place that's inexpensive and closer to the things they want to do. However, I was quite pleased with my stay at the Wyndham Apollo Hotel. My hotel room was moderately priced in comparison to other European hotel fares and the room was shockingly larger than what I am accustomed to. If you are going for luxury you will defiantly find it in the lobby, restaurant, and bar, which also provides a very cozy atmosphere for an evening meal or cocktail. I would recommend this hotel to any tourist but especially for Americans. The hotel staff spoke perfect English and was very accommodating. They were able to answer any questions and provide me with wonderful directions and tips. This is a lovely hotel and is actually not that far out from the city. I would undoubtedly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Most Amazing European Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: hanberrykm
Reviews.Content: This hotel was truly a gem! My friend and I actually planned to stay here last minute for New Year's, and we could't have gotten a better place to stay. First of all, the staff at this hotel were the nicest and most helpful people I have ever met in a hotel setting. Every time we would walk into the lobby each one would greet us with a smile and ask how our day was. They were also eager to help out with suggestions of things to do and see while in Amsterdam and great directions. One staff member even took out a map and drew on it for me circling where points of interest were and the tram ways that we would need to take to get there. The hotel itself is absolutely beautiful! The location is perfect, not right in the city center but not too far from everything either. The lobby was so warm and welcoming. There was a warm fire next to the bar we cuddled up to one night with a few glasses of wine provided a very relaxing, sophisticated environment after a busy day of sightseeing. Our guest room was one of the best I had ever stayed in throughout all of my European travels. It was quite spacious and the view overlooking the area where about five canals meet was incredible, I felt I was looking at a postcard when I looked out my window. The bed was comfy and cozy. The bathroom was spacious as well with pretty sparkling marble floors. All in all, our experience at the Wyndham Apollo was amazing to say the least! Dutch hospitality at it's finest!

Reviews.Title: “Could be a decent hotel, but they messed us around”
Reviews.Author: archios
Reviews.Content: First to the main bad point: We arrived on the Sat having paid for the room in advance through lastminute.com only to be told that due to a malfunction with the hotel's booking system that they had lost our reservation. Apparently this had affected quite a few guests as well as ourselves as there were quite a few people milling around the reception area. Despite having my booking ref the guy at reception told me that they had no rooms available & were sending people to another hotel for the night while they sorted the rooms out. I then produced an email I'd received from the hotel just the day before confirming my reservation after I'd emailed them in advance of our arrival. I always do this now as an extra confirmation after a previous experience of booking through a website & discovering the hotel didn't have my reservation upon arrival. The guy took my email & disappeared off out the back to discuss it with his colleagues, then a couple of minutes later he was back and hey presto! turns out they did have rooms available after all and they offered us one. I don't know who was to blame for this, whether it was lastminute.com or the hotel, but the fact that they were turning people with reservations away & telling them they were full when they had rooms available after all was very dodgy indeed! The manager then called us when we were in the room and apologised, stating that we should never have been asked to leave in the 1st place. I hope they extended that apology to all the other people they did turn away, because it was only the email confirmation that I had the foresight to get that prevented us being moved too. The room itself was fine. Nice & clean. Recently refurbished, though the bathroom didn't look to have been. Flush on the toilet was weak and big gap under shower door means water gets all over the floor. The staff were all polite, with the exception of the gruff & unsmiling concierge. Location is in a lovely suburb. Not particularly close to the centre, but only a 15 min tram ride from the nearby apollolaan stop. Amsterdam hotels are generally pretty pricey, and although not particularly cheap this is a decently priced option for a weekend away. Ask for a refurbished room though, and get email confirmation from the hotel itself before you arrive!

Reviews.Title: “This is a good hotel for business meetings with great food--but the rooms badly need updating and they need more staff”
Reviews.Author: TravelGirl8033
Reviews.Content: My room had torn carpet and scraped furniture. The shower, despite my being warned, had a huge gap resulting in enormous amounts of water spilled on the floor--even when I plugged the gap with a towel. Two times housekeeping did not clean my room before dinner--even when I was gone from 9 am until 1 pm. The concierge couldn't recommend a place for dinner closer than Leidesplein (where there are tons of restaurants), but we managed to find a delicious italian restaurant 2 blocks away on Beethovenplein. I kept asking, "Isn't there something closer?" And, the kicker of all was that I arrived at 9 am and asked them to call me as soon as a room was ready. I returned at 3 pm (desperately exhausted), not having received a call, yet the room was ready. Guess they couldn't make a call, even though they had agreed to do so. The location was a good walk to the tram and then a tram ride to the more active parts of the city. The Marriott looks like a much better location. Dinner at the restaurant was amazing--and worth a separate trip though.

Reviews.Title: “Nice lobby, shame about the hotel...”
Reviews.Author: sswain81
Reviews.Content: I booked into the Wyndham Apollo due to a special offer on-line and was impressed by the pictures of the hotel on its website. First impressions are impressive, as you walk into an elegant, large lobby which looks definitely in keeping with its 4 star rating. However, that was far and away the best part of the hotel. We were allocated a room on the ground floor, facing the canal. The room was incredibly dated - the mirror was stained with what looked like paint, there were water mark stains on the ceiling of the main room and the bathroom had no hand soap at all. We asked for some soap, only to be told that the hotel had run out and we should use the hair/body shower gel to wash our hands with instead. Very classy. The television in the room was probably a good 5 years old plus, and the alleged interactive features failed to work at all - no internet through the TV, nor movies on demand etc. It all felt like it was about 2000, not 2011, and felt like a poor three star hotel - nowhere near a four star. The only clues that it was a four star hotel were the lobby and, unfortunately, the prices. I cannot believe that a four star hotel fails to provide free wireless in this day and age, but the Wyndham Apollo doesn't and instead looks to charge a fortune for even short access. Needless to say, we didn't bother paying the inflated prices, nor the silly prices for food and drink in the hotel. It's also a good 35/40 minute walk out of the centre, or about 15 minutes by tram. There are definitely far better, cheaper hotels nearer the city than this, which makes it very tough to recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and staff - surprizing bed bug problem”
Reviews.Author: Tequila172
Reviews.Content: I thought the hotel was really lovely. It may be a bit far from some parts of city, but it was super easy to get there by tram, or a bit of a longer walk when the weather is nice. Also the internet was extremely expensive and it was really slow - so that wasn't too impressive, but at first I thought the hotel was really quite nice.. but then....After 3 nights, I started to notice bites on my legs. My other friend didn't, and told me I was imagining things, so I never said anything. Some nights they came and others they didn't. However, now that I am back in Canada.. bites have started again after being back only a few days.... pest control has come and has confirmed a new infestation of bed bugs. Sadly, I am confused, cause I thought the hotel was nice and clean... now I don't know what to think. It was impossible to see if there were bugs on their beds.. cause the matrices r black.....

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel, would stay again”
Reviews.Author: MissChina2510
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Secret Hotels on LastMinute.com and was a bit sceptical after reading the reviews on Trip Advisor ... however I needn't have worried. The staff were extremely friendly, happy and polite. Fantastic service ... especially when I sprained my ankle half way through the trip. They couldn't do enough for me. The hotel is slightly out of the centre, but there is a bus and tram stop 1 minute walk from the hotel. It's located in a slightly quieter, but 'hip' area Du Pijpe, and only 30 walk from the centre. Means you get to see some of real Amsterdam, rather than just the tourist ridden centre, but that is really easy to get to should you wish. Our room was on the 6th floor, with canal views and views across the whole city. An impecably clean, modern room. Bed was so comfortable, I couldn't fault the room in any way. Would definitely return here and can highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing potential, just not quite there yet.”
Reviews.Author: Aeonweir
Reviews.Content: This seems to have been taken over fairly recently by the Wyndham chain, possibly lock stock and barrel. It is an idyllic location on the water edge, very quiet - slightly removed from public transport but bearable. Interesting design to the building. This could be a diamond, but it is still a bit in the rough because of the room furnishings and bathrooms; the marine theme needs a serious updating. The public areas are much better presented. The staff were very helpful and unusually for Amsterdam, actually cheerful.

Reviews.Title: “Wyndham Apollo could have been so great!”
Reviews.Author: Sjurontour
Reviews.Content: The Apollo has a beautiful location in the southern part of Amsterdam - where many canals meet in front of the hotel - what a location. In general the public areas are nice and comfortable. There is, however, a big problem with this hotel: We had a beautiful modern and comfortable room, but we also saw a room which was totally worn out! Treadbare carpets!

Reviews.Title: “We're awfully sorry. And we'll apologize to the next guest, too.”
Reviews.Author: JADSanDiego_CA
Reviews.Content: Ah, the pleasures of an "executive" room at a rundown hotel that's tacked "Wyndham" to its sign to lure the unsuspecting traveler. The only thing that topped the intermittent internet service was the intermittent temperature control on the shower, which went from scalding to lukewarm to scalding again in mere seconds. The staff promised to fix both, a promise I'm sure they make to all guests of room 550 on a regular basis. When staying here, be sure the visit the Fitness Museum to view some of the finest 1960 exercise equipment still in service...lovely. This venue also observes two hallowed European hotel traditions. First, following one's shower, more water has ended up on the floor than down the drain; second, you'll be charged for breakfast whether you ventured into the dining area or not, in the hope that you'll miss the ensuing charge. As I didn't, a simple 20 minute discussion resulted in a refund. Along with the phantom mini-bar charge. The staff is nattily dressed, and efficiently apologetic. If you're someone who enjoys a good apology, you'll love the Wyndham Apollo.

Reviews.Title: “Wyndam Apollo Hotel”
Reviews.Author: motorcar1
Reviews.Content: Good value hotel in real nice area convenient to transport and city centre. Booked through Aer Lingus website, way cheaper than Wyndam website, even phoned them but they would not match price.

Reviews.Title: “Calm hotel a little too far from the centre”
Reviews.Author: SomiLondon
Reviews.Content: Like many others, I got this hotel from lastminute.com as a 'secret' hotel. It's best to arrive at the South Station from the aiport from where is is a â‚¬7.50 taxi ride. We were upgraded to a suite overlooking the canal which was great. Room a little tired but the old furniture has some style. Great beds and lovely bathroom. With a 10 year old, the walk to the Museums was OK, about 15 minutes but really a bit too far from the old centre. Very helpful staff, nice atmosphere

Reviews.Title: “Good Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Veronika78
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Lastminute.com at Â£80 a night as a Top Secret Hotel. We were not disappointed. We have booked TSH three times now so were not too worried. We did our research and knew the hotel was not centrally located but had good links into town (about 10/15 mins on the tram). Walking is also possible - about half an hour to the centre. The hotel is about 8/10 mins walk from the museum quarter so that was good for us. Distance from airport - 20 mins on the train to Amsterdam Centraal and then tram ride - 15 mins. Hotel is 5 mins walk from the tram stop, a little less if you are a fast walker! The hotel looked nice from the outside with views of canals, houses and a Shell petrol station (good for getting waters/drinks/snacks). We arrived at about 10.30am and were told our room would not be available till 2/3pm. We were allowed to check in and our bags put in the safe area so we were free to go into the city and wander around. We came back to the hotel about 4.30pm and were given a room on the 6th floor facing the canal! The room was beautiful. Newly refurbished in lime green/black/white colours. A nice comfy bed, AC, extra blankets & pillows, a mini bar (we were allowed to put our own things into it), flat screen tv, desk, nice clean bathroom with gorgeous toiletries! The windows were nice and big. We were very happy with it. The room was cleaned spotlessly each day. We did not have breakfast at the hotel as we thought it a little expensive at 22â‚¬ pp. You can get reasonable meals at places in the centre (wraps, omelettes, pancakes etc). Restaurants are expensive but there are many fast food/sandwich type places to eat. The average meal is around Â£16 and we were mostly spending about 25â‚¬ for the two of us for lunch and dinner cost us almost 50â‚¬! We only had dinner on 2 nights. We opted for brunch and a late lunch instead of 3 meals a day. We did not have any issues with the service. Receptionists were polite. We drank all the tea/coffee one of the afternoons so next morning we had nothing to drink. I went into the corridors and found a cleaner. Told her we needed some tea/coffee/milk. She handed me a handful of stuff!! No questions asked. Overall a pleasant stay. On the day we checked out, we kept our luggage at the central station lockers (very secure and safe - about 7â‚¬ for 24 hrs for the big locker) so we were free to do things and get back to the station to catch the train to the airport. We enjoyed our trip. Found eating out a little expensive for the qualify of food so be careful where you eat and what. Lots to see and do and lots of walking so comfy shoes are a MUST. Train from aiport to city costs 3.70â‚¬ one way. Try to get a tram pass for 24/48/72h in advance. SOmetimes the drivers claimed they only had 1h cards, which are a rip off! P.S.// the hotel has a little gym and a Health SPA.

Reviews.Title: “A fine place to stay..”
Reviews.Author: cscs89
Reviews.Content: overall, is a nice hotel.. but the 12 euro(24hour) wireless net sucks big time... It can only view non flash website... if u want to watch eg. youtube, forget about it... the download speed is less than 0.33 m/bit...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Little_Travel_Bug_11
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner have now stayed at this hotel twice. The last time we visited was about 18 months ago in October 2009. The first time we visited, we had an early morning flight so arrived in Amsterdam at about 9am. We were absolutely shattered and despite knowing that we couldn't check in to the hotel until 3pm, we thought we'd chance it and headed straight there. We caught a taxi at the airport and this will cost you between 40 and 45 euros. It's not bad really as it is about a 20 minute drive from the airport. When we got there, we asked the Receptionist if there was any chance of checking in a bit earlier i.e. maybe about 12ish and we couldn't believe our luck when she said they already had a room sorted for us and could check in straight away, at no extra cost may I add! We didn't have to worry about it this time round though as we opted for an afternoon flight and got to the hotel at 5pm. Each visit has been perfect and I really cannot fault this hotel. Service is brilliant, the reception staff, bar staff, and even the cleaners smile at you and always say 'hello'. They make you feel at home and are always happy to help. The lady in the bar, Mieke, was very friendly and would always tell us to grab a table and she would bring your drinks to you. It's a very clean and modern hotel, the rooms have loads of space and the beds are the comfiest beds I have ever slept in. When I checked out in Oct 09, I even asked the Receptionist where they got their beds from! The only down side is that it is very expensive, as are most hotels to be honest. Me and my Partner never had breakfast at the hotel as it's 12.50 euros just for a couple of croissants and 22.50 euros for a full breakfast. If you wanted room service then it was an extra 10 euros service charge. Therefore we would just venture into the city centre for a bite to eat. As can be expected, the mini-bar in the room is also very expensive i.e. 7 euros for a small pot of mixed nuts and 40 euros for a small bottle of bubbly. There is a Shell Petrol Station just round the corner from the hotel, so we would just get some drinks and snacks from there and keep them in our room. Location of the hotel is good and is situated within a quieter region of the city, therefore ideal for a romantic getaway. It's then just a short tram ride into the centre which costs 2.60 euros per person and this is valid for an hour, so you can hop on and off as many trams as you like within this period. Me and my Partner have had two great stays at this hotel and I would highly recommend to all couples out there who want to experience the hustle and bustle of Amsterdam, but want to wake up and go to sleep in peace. If you want to stay in a hotel closer to the centre, then you have to accept that it is probably going to be noisy in the evenings as there is always lots going on. To sum up, a great hotel with great staff, good location but just a bit on the expensive side.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel, shame about the location”
Reviews.Author: tmc2902
Reviews.Content: me and my partner have just returned from a weekend break in amsterdam. We booked this hotel through 'secret hotel' on lastminute.com, and were disappointed with the location, its a bit far out if you are used to staying in walking disstance of the heart of the city. we didnt have any problems with the hotel, apart from that on arrival to the hotel late at night following a nightmare journey to find the hotel from central station we were advised that they didnt have a room ready for use. To say i was disappointed was an understatement, i had seen prior to my trip that other reviewers had comented on this, however i hoped it would not happen to us, but hey! we were moved to a 5 star hotel near by (in the middle of no where) for the nite and told to return the following day at 12 noon. Once back at the hotel i spoke to a manager, who apologies and provided us with an upgraded room to make up for the hassle. The room we eventually got was really nice, right on the canal with a gorgeous view of the canal. All in all i enjoyed my stay at the hotel , just wish it was a bit closer to the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay at Wyndham”
Reviews.Author: Fiferover94
Reviews.Content: We ended up at the Wyndham through the secret hotels gamble on lastminute.com, and can honestly say we were highly satisfied with the outcome. The hotel is a pleasant 20 minute walk from the city centre (depending on what side of the canal you walk up - the right hand side of the canal going toward the city centre had a mini-Red Light district!). It's also a 10 minute walk from the Rijksmuseum and the Van Gogh Museum. We enjoy walking about to get to know the city so we didn't use public transport, but there seemed to be plenty of trams passing us on the way to the city centre. We had read some of the Tripadvisor reviews about the poor condition of the rooms that had not been refurbished. So we asked someone in the hotel if our booking was for a refurbished room using the excellent chat service on the apollohotelsresorts.com website. Our contact was very helpful - she told us that this could not be guaranteed, but we could upgrade to a canal view refurbished room for â‚¬25 per night. We ended up taking our chances. When we arrived (by taxi from Schipol, roughly â‚¬35) we had been upgraded to a refurbushed canal view room. Result. The hotel is on a junction of 5 canals and is directly across from the local rowing club, so there was always something going in the water when you looked out the window (all very peaceful I should add, although the odd musical barge went past early in the evening). The room was excellent - a fair size, fine decor, Van Gogh style prints, leather chair and footrest to unwind on, plus a minibar which was a normal fridge and not one of these sensor-triggered jobs that charges you if you move a can of beer. The only complaint we had was with the bed - the sheets didn't seem to fit properly, and when we woke up they had ridden up and were gathered in the middle of the bed. No big deal but the only real complaint we had. Staff were all very pleasant, the concierge was very helpful on our departure. We did not have meals or drinks at the hotel. There was a garage next to the hotel which sold all the traveller basics and a bakers just up the road (baakerswinkel) which has top cakes and scones. Yes, that's how interesting we are. Overall I'd recommend this hotel as a great base to stay at if you are looking for a quiet break.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel, great sleep, good service”
Reviews.Author: welsh_minxCardiff
Reviews.Content: We got this via a secret hotel deal on lastminute.com - and were really happy with it - it's a short tram into the centre but most of the time we walked in, as it's based in a nice neighbourhood so it's nice to walk.... We had a room on the ground floor, the beds were really comfy so we slept really well. The bathroom smelled slightly damp but it was fine. the guy on the desk when we arrived was really friendly and made us feel very welcome and at home! Would definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Lovely room, lovely hotel, service could be better”
Reviews.Author: TBTA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights at the end of March for a city break. We booked it on last minute.com as a secret hotel so only paid Â£300 for 4 nights. The reviews on here were mixed though so we were a little concerned. The only down side to our stay was the service from reception. We arrived early and thought we'd see if we could check in but unfortunately a room wasn't available. According to our booking, check-in was at 2pm but we arrived at 12pm so waited in reception. 2pm came though and we were then told by reception that their official check-in time was 3pm. It was a bit frustrating and we had hoped that as we were sat in reception for 3 hours they may have got a room ready but no, they kept us waiting until the bitter end! After that it was all good though. We got given a lovely room (440) over looking the canal. It was very quiet and spacious. A really comfy bed. A good thermostat to get the room to the right temperature too so never too hot or cold! The hotel is quite a long way out of the centre. However it only takes 10 minutes on the tram. We walked it a couple of times and it took 45 minutes. It is worthwhile getting a tram pass. It was 2.60â‚¬ for 1 hour, 7â‚¬ for 24 hours or 11â‚¬ for 48 hours. You can buy for longer if you want and you can hop on and off as much as you want then. It was simple to get from the airport to the hotel. The train from the airport to central station run regulalry and cost about â‚¬6. Then get on the 24 or 5 tram outside the station to the Apollolaan Station. Turn left off the tram and the hotel is about a 5 minute walk. Lots of great places to eat and drink. AllStars doesn't look much from outside but does the best steak! Final point to warn you about. When we checked out of the hotel we were presented with a bill for a City Tax for each night of our stay which we weren't expecting. It cost us 17â‚¬ for the 4 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sarahthegiraffe
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel a week and a half before our trip as a lastminute.com mystery hotel for Â£150 for friday and saturday. I was initially worried by previous reviews that it was going to be horrible, but we were pleasantly surprised on arrival. It was a bit far out, but for the price you'd expect that and it was lovely. We had been upgraded to a refurbished room (so maybe there are still some old rooms that could do with some attention) but our twin bedroom was comfortable and well furnished and the lobby and bar area was very plush and nice. Pretty much Malmaison/Crowne Plaza stylee. We were two late twenties girls up for exploring, but wanting a comfortable safe place to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “beatiful hotel booked through expedia and got charged by expedia and hotel.. not a happy bunny...”
Reviews.Author: Sinead29
Reviews.Content: Got charged twice 1 from expedia when i book it a month before i went, and the other from hotel when we booked out..Hotel is a bit far out form the centre... about 10 stops in the tram... if i was going to holland again i would book a bit closer to the centre...It was a beautiful hotel.. Breakfast far too expensive Â£22.50 pp.. rip off...

Reviews.Title: “Rooms need a serious upgrade”
Reviews.Author: mohargis
Reviews.Content: As I travel for business in Europe circa 10 times per year, and I am generally in Amsterdam at least two of those times, I will not be staying at this hotel again. Upon check-in I requested whether it would be possible for a room upgrade as I was booked on a first floor room and knew that I was staying in this hotel for 7 nights and paying circa US $2300 total. After some searching, the very nice gentleman at the reception said he was able to secure me an upgraded room on the 5th floor with a balcony - which I eagerly took. Upon entrance to the floor, I was met with a large stain in front of the elevator. Obviously not the best omen. I entered the hotel room, which according to the fire escape chart was smaller than other rooms, but I discovered I had a large balcony which was quite an unexpected surprise and made up for the space. However, the room itself in no way shape or form matched the website pictures, the furniture was very run down which ample chips and cracks, the gold lounge chairs (which, while very comfy) had numerous stains all over them, the side table was wobbly with large cracks and plastic peeling off it, the tub had black mildew stains in the caulking, and somehow the toilet also had stains leading all the way into the bowls bottom. Overall, not a pleasant sight. On the plus side, the bed seemed comfortable. So, I called down to reception, and requested a room that matched the website pictures. The receptionist asked which website did I use, as the pictures were not representative of the rooms available. I told her I used the Wyndham website. She said that the pictures used were put up by Wyndham as stock photos. Then I inquired whether there were any rooms which had been renovated, and she tartly stated that she noticed I had already been upgraded to a larger room, but that if I absolutely wanted a smaller room which had the same view, but no balcony, but had been renovated that I could pay an additional 30 euros for one. Thanks, but no thanks - especially if the room might or might-not match the pictures on the website. In prior trips to Amsterdam, I have stayed at the Hotel Okura, which is nearby the Wyndham, and the Park Hotel and Renaissance Amsterdam hotels downtown. I would recommend one of these hotels over this one until all the rooms are renovated and the pictures match the rooms. I uploaded some pictures which are more indicative of the rooms below for other TripAdvisors.

Reviews.Title: “meet here - sleep elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: Michael_M_Moscow
Reviews.Content: + good breakfast, good conference facilities, attentive staff, quiet - rooms badly need renovation, uncomfortable bed, far away from all attractions not a 4 star hotel by any means - 3* at best

Reviews.Title: “trust in tripadvisors!”
