Reviews.Author: CannelleITALY
Reviews.Content: I was in Amsterdam for Business and my company reserved me this hotel . After reservation (sic!) I checked Tripadvisor and...well believe tripadvisors! Looking to another review I decided to take with me 'just in case' the reservation with descriptin of the room I reserved (superior, view on the city). The location is far from the center (you need a taxci to reach it). When I arrived, I had to wait 20' for the check in (4 people behind the desk , with 3 of them doing nothing, just looking...). The concierge (a woman very rude) told me they reserved me " a very good room". When I entered in the room I discovered the view was literally 2 meters far from the parking!! Very rumorous, etc....so I went back at the reception telling that was not my room, as Amsterdam is not a parking and that was not a city view my reservation described (I has to show them the paper with description of the reserved room)....as told from another one on tripadvisor , they told that 'just to make a favour' they were going to change the room with a superios class one withour extra cost... the room was quite good: godd fornitures but unfortunatley not very clean anyway. The morning after I asked for breakfast with was really expensive respect to the cappuccino and croissant I asked for!! Th only really gentle person of the staff was the man serving breakfast: the only one to smile to clients and really, really polite. Next time I'll be in Amsterdam I change hotel for sure! Apollo no more!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, very relaxed and friendly.”
Reviews.Author: TrionaCork
Reviews.Content: I have just returned after a weekend in Amsterdam. The room was modern and large the hotel very inviting and spacious. We felt we had our privacy at all times but had great service when we neededit. There was a tram around the corner and the area is safe and a calm oasis from the town centre. We will be heading back in the summer and will definitely be staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: bbb1987
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wyndham Apollo hotel for 3 nights at the end of August 2010. Our experience was perhaps affected by the weather (it rained for 3 days in a row) and by the taxi driver who tried to rip us off, knowing we are foreigners, on the fare from the train station to the hotel. The hotel is located roughly 6km south from the train station, so it's pretty far from major landmarks, and beware taxis nor public transport are in no way cheap. The lobby and the ground floor area is nicely furnished and makes a pretty good impression, yet on the whole it feels pretty cold and not too welcoming. You had to pay for the Internet, which I personally hate, and the rooms definitely felt outdated. There was no sauna, no swimming pool nor a fitness center, only a spa, for which you had to pay extra. There aren't too many restaurants around, and I'm pretty sure there are better hotels within this price range that are worthy of attention. I would not recommend this hotel to any of my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lukey2911
Reviews.Content: we stayed here in january 2011 for 3 nights.... Arrived at hotel early due to flight was not expecting to be able to be allocated a room but was without any problems. Room was a good size with everything needed to enjoy our stay. Modern and clean, The bed was huge and so comfy I slept better in the hotel than i do in my own bed! :) The only downside to the hotel would be its room service menu and general food on offer. The food is not very exciting and is very expensive.. Coffee and Croissant 12 euros!!!!! The hotel is only a short tram ride in to the centre of amsterdam roughly around 10 mins so had no problems getting around.

Reviews.Title: “For the price you pay, it should be perfection...sadly it isn't at all.”
Reviews.Author: elisa5000
Reviews.Content: When you walk into the hotel, you expect it to be fabulous. Great entrance! After this first impression we met dissapointment after dissapointment. It took a very long time to check in (25min). When we finally received our key, going through the halls was just odd. Ripped rugs, yellow wallpaper,... When we entered the room it was nice, we must say that the bed was GREAT. The sad thing was that the Tv was running, advertising pay per view movies. Even "adult enterainment"...tacky. The bathroom...where do I begin? Chipped paint, rusty and broken tiles, horrible water pressure (had to wash my hair in the sink), blow dryer did not work, exposed wire because they added a phone... Although it was clean, not what you would expect from this type of hotel. Breakfast was ok, again not what you would expect. Orange juice from a bottle, frozen butter ( over an hour at the table, and it still wasn't usable) overdone bacon is just not done in this price range. The view from the dining room was, however, spectacular. PS: for one of the staff: If you drop hard-boiled eggs when coming out of the kitchen (which can happen to anyone once in while) don't put them on the buffet!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: TheBallingsMn
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel through last minute deals and decided to splurge on a non-typical European hotel for the last three nights of our 16 day honeymoon. First of all, for a five star hotel, we expected a lot so we may be a bit more critical than we would be for a 3 star but that being said, the hotel in general was very comfortable. It is not near the main hubs of Amsterdam but we didn't mind taking the tram and having to walk. We were adventuresome when we arrived and rather than take the 35 euro taxi from the Central train station, we finally found the right tram (number 24) and rode to the Apollean stop. We had to ask for directions and then walk for about 10 minutes but did arrive for only 5.60 euro for both! (Would be a nightmare if you had a lot of luggage!) Our room was very good size, a nice bed and very clean! We had read about old rooms verses newly decorated and frankly, I am not sure what ours was. There was purple everywhere - carpet, paneling, paint but it wasn't obnoxious--again, very clean and very large compared to everything else on our trip. It felt like an American hotel in Amsterdam. Here are the minor complaints. We would expect a five star hotel to replenish the shampoo/body wash stuff every day. They didn't and by day 3, they were gone. Although they provided a nice tea pot, after day 1, they did not replenish the creamer or the sugar--and only one tea bag the last day. I hated the pillows - too bulky and huge but hubby liked them. Also, the internet was an issue. Only one device can be used per room and we were advised that they were beginning to charge starting November 22. Again, a 5 star, one would think, would provide free internet services. Note of caution: if the shower head sprays on the small glass door, you can have a minor bathroom flood! Our room deal included the breakfast buffet and when we went to check in, I mentioned this to the desk person who looked very skeptical. I pulled out my iPad, showed him the reservation confirmation from Last Minute, which he then had to take to show his manager. She then confirmed that it was included but we felt like we would not have been "believed" had I not had the iPad confirmation. The breakfast buffet was FANTASTIC! There is so much food, the service was outstanding and it really was great to have this to start our three days. Our flight left early on the last day so we had to be there right at 630 and eat fast but the staff was accommodating and we were really glad to have the option. Wyndham Apollo is a nice place, not a typical European joint at all but after a long trip, we were pleased to have the comforts at the end of our honeymoon. I don't know that I would stay there if I didn't have a great rate that included breakfast...but it was clean, relaxing and perfect of us---this time.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel stay”
Reviews.Author: misscherry17
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel from Friday - Monday at the beginning of Nov. This hotel is lovely on the outside and inside, but the location isn't near the city centre. Room was nice and big for 2 of us, so no complaints there. Closest tram/bus to city is a 10 min walk. We were lucky to book this as a secret hotel so got a cheap rate (Â£200 for 3 nights). Also the internet is extremely pricy as I was quoted one price, but the information was wrong. Only use if you need it urgently! After I returned home after this trip, I was very unimpressed realised the hotel was holding Â£200 which was for 'incidentals' which I wasn't told about up front. The money was being frozen in my bank account, so I called the hotel directly (on the Tuesday) and spoke to the Finance department who didn't really show any empathy but assisted with the situation. By Thursday the money was still not there, and I contacted the hotel again. Luckily by Monday my money was there, however based on this experience I don't think I would stay here again. If I was informed beforehand that this money would be on 'hold' I wouldnt have any isses, but the fact that money was missing and it took almost 1 week to be reconciled concerns me.

Reviews.Title: “Seriously? 3/4 of the hotel is stuck in the 70s while the other 1/4 is decent...”
Reviews.Author: Maast
Reviews.Content: I was unfortunately to receive a "normal" room (for a very very expensive rate)... And believe me the room felt it was coming straight from the seventies! All worn out and terribly sad. I would've been fine if it was an hotel under 60 euros a night but it was over 200 euros a night so I was extremely disappointed. Front desk and bar staff were extremely cold, if not even rude! Actually I've never been in an hotel with so much rude staff, and I visit nearly 50 a year! So, if you're in Amsterdam, go someplace else!

Reviews.Title: “All in all, a Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: MikeAbroad66
Reviews.Content: This is an OK corporate-type hotel with clean, good-size rooms, and a fairly good location (still a 20 minute walk to City Center), but poor management killed the deal for us. We had one small problem after another, (eg no ventilation, keys didn't work, housekeeping 'forgot' our room, etc) and at no point did the hotel offer to 'make things right' for us. Internet is complete rip-off and there is no way to print your boarding pass or anything else while there. My best advice is take this hotel only in a pinch - and know what you are getting. The upside: Amsterdam is a great city!

Reviews.Title: “It's Easy to Get Off to a Rocky Start in this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Selahrs
Reviews.Content: Our Chicago tour group landed in Amsterdam at 7:00 AM after a long direct flight. We were exhausted and eager to get into our rooms to freshen up and/or nap. But we were told that check-in time was an inflexible 3:00 PM and that we should "walk around the City" for six hours, until our rooms were ready. A few of us almost collapsed at this news. Some had made prior arrangements to see the Anne Frank House and so they were able to make use of the time. However most of us felt at loose ends. We were told we were not entitled to the free breakfast on this first day of our stay (although the ample breakfast buffet was included for subsequent days). We went into the adjunct dining room, hoping we could get a coffee and a roll, something to enliven us a little. There, the very supercillious maitre de informed us that we had to order a minimum of $10 E. per person - the price of a croissant and a demitasse of coffee. This self-important overseer of the dining area later warmed up to us though and allowed us to spend just $10 E per table rather than per person. He became generally more affable. But this did little to buck us up. After the croissant and coffee, most of us wandered, fatigued and droopy to the nth degree. Since the Hotel is far on the outskirts of Amsterdam, it was difficult to walk to the downtown area, although some connections with public transit were available within a few blocks. We made the best of it, trudging around town, getting as far as the Concert Hall and the Van Gogh Museum in central Amsterdam - although we were far too tired to take in either of these. We got back to the Hotel early and hung around the lobby until our rooms were ready. Then, when I REALLY needed to rest, I found I had another time-consuming ordeal ahead of me. My roommate and I found that we had been assigned a room with a single, very constricted bed. Since she and I were virtual strangers to each other, this seemed like it would crowd us into an unacceptable level of togetherness. We asked to be transferred to a room with twin beds. This caused a lengthy further delay. We were finally accommodated in what the hotel concierge said was the Hotel's "last room with twin beds." So we had to make do. But again, we found the situation less than ideal. By "twin," this Hotel meant beds considerally narrower than what the average American considers a "twin." Although the beds were clean and the mattresses comfortable enough, these beds were more the size of Army cots. In her deep sleep, my roommate rolled clear out of her bed and crashed to the floor in the middle of our first night there. Luckily, she didn't injure herself. Then, we couldn't fathom the shower. It was an odd arrangement with a partially-bending plexiglass screen covering half the tub. This screen just seemed to serve to deflect the water all over the floors and ceiling of the entire bathroom. So we had to mop up before we could finally, finally get into bed. There were positives about the Hotel though. Almost all the staff members spoke perfect English, and they were very friendly and accommodating when it came to helping us make up for any lapses in our packing. For example, my roommate had not brought the proper converters or transformers to make her curling irons work. The Hotel brought up the proper additional equipment on loan - in the middle of the night and at dawn again, without even requesting a deposit from her. The Hotel was in a nice setting. Its back door and patio overlooked one of the loveliest turns in Amsterdam's canal systems. The wharf adjacent to the Hotel was blooming with red geraniums. In the front of the Hotel, in its parking lot, there was a lovely oasis that included a pond stocked with a variety of interesting fish. This parkland oasis included a bench where the weary traveler could rest and relax. Then when we were allowed the free breakfast the next morning, we found it to be sumptuous and delicious - with an unlimited supply of American-style coffee available. There was one omission on their buffet breakfast menu though. When a member of our group asked for "oatmeal" - the server looked perplexed and finally, apparently having misunderstood, brought her a pitcher of "hot milk." It was the only lapse in communication we experienced while we were there. Overall, our experience here wasn't too bad, but it was difficult to make up for that rocky first day.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, bad toilet design!”
Reviews.Author: rajooj
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 days, liked my stay, nice rooms, location and connections by tram. However, I was surprised with the way the attached toilets of the rooms are designed. I found it VERY BADLY designed and one has to be very careful especially to get in and out of the shower... senior citizens beware...

Reviews.Title: “Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: gvsartor
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, clean, enough close to downtown. Do not ask fore extras, very expensive!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: stewmassie
Reviews.Content: We stayed here whilst having a long weekend in Amsterdam. It's located a couple of miles south but it wasn't a problem for us. The number 5 tram stops nearby and takes you to the heart of the city or a couple of stops south to Amsterdam Zuid train station. Situated right at the side of the canal, the hotel offers boats for hire at reasonable rates. Our room was large, modern and clean. The only minus would be that there were little things like bottles of water, mini bar, TV and drinks at the bar which were all pretty expensive.

Reviews.Title: “nice trip but dissapointing rooms”
Reviews.Author: nicwin367
Reviews.Content: just returned from a lovely trip to Amsterdam we booked 2 double executive rooms which overlooked the front of the hotel and not the lovely views of the canals which was a shame. We were impressed with the hotel reception as very modern with nice furnishings. We were able to store our bags securly as we arrived 08:30 but couldn't check in untill 3pm. However when we did finally get into our rooms I was dissapointed, although a good size and clean they could really do with a lick of paint and a refurbish. Furniture was tired and just didn't match up with the lovely furniture in the reception. Also no safe in either room so we had to keep leaving personals in the locked store room down stairs. Breakfast was good. plenty of selection and the staff in Hotel were very freindly but then all the Dutch people were. Didn't mind the out of town location as it wasn't far to walk to the tram stop and I felt we were in a nice safe area. Although we enjoyed our stay wouldn't recommend the hotel to a friend unless they got a really good deal because of the tired rooms- such a shame

Reviews.Title: “Nice City Hotel with great views”
Reviews.Author: Ele007London
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nicely situated at the waterfront with superb views to one of the channels. From the outside it looks more like an old-fashioned congress center. However the inside is really nice and modern. The rooms are spacious and nicely furnished. Bathroom was fully equipped and immaculate. Breakfast buffet was also very nice, although on the expensive side at 22,50 â‚¬. Unfortunately it's too far away from the city center to walk, but you can get there easily by taxi for 7,50 â‚¬. Staff was very nice and attentive and I had an overall pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but not a city location”
Reviews.Author: Playmate1987
Reviews.Content: This hotel was nice however out of the city which meant that you had to get a bus or tram into the centre, this however was not to much of a major problem in the day time as they run very frequently, however in the night is was a very diffrent story. If you are going to Amsterdam for the city shopping, nightlife or smoking this is NOT the hotel for you as the travel is just to much to do daily. The hotel itself was ok not of a 4* standard we stayed in a "Deluxe city view room" which consisted of a side view of the very end of the canal? (Not acceptable to pass the room category off as a city view whatsoever in my personal opion), the room was extremely basic and the beds (Single) were very small, just enough space for you to sleep on your side! I have to say if this was a Deluxe room that I honestly dreed to think what their basic room type looks like? The breakfast was average in terms of what was on offer, hot & cold options, the hotel had very helpful staff which did make the stay enjoyable, if it was in a better location then I would definatly stay back there for the stay was comfortable but I would rate it a 3* rather than a 4* hotel. It's worth it if you get a cheap deal on easytobook.com.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable, great service.”
Reviews.Author: Minxyminou
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel. There was a mixup with our tripadvisor reservation upon arrival however the friendly, professional staff were exceptionally helpful in sorting the misunderstanding out for us. We were upgraded to a beautiful canal view room. The bathroom was lovely and the bed was huge and comfortable. The hotel was spacious and very clean. On the flipside. The hotel is quite far from the city center so if you're in Amsterdam to enjoy the nightlife this may not be the best choice. There is also no in-room wifi and time online is very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “not that bad”
Reviews.Author: uk2dubai
Reviews.Content: not really located in the centre, but still a comfortable walk from most interesting sights.. excellent rooms, very comfrotable beds. best of all is to get a room facing the canals, you dont need a tv with that view... have been at better hotels, but for an old european city, this is really not bad, also excellent value for money. advise, skip the overpriced hotel breakfast, take a brisk walk towards rijksmuseum, and there are lots of alternatives with better breakfast offers, and this goes for quality as well as price

Reviews.Title: “Okay but I've stayed at better 4-star hotels”
Reviews.Author: brightsunhere
Reviews.Content: The room was okay. The sheet had holes and the bathroom wasn't as clean as we hoped for. We have stayed at much better 4-star hotels in that price range. If you ever go to Berlin I highly recommend Tierpark hotel. Very nice and we are still (one year later) talking about their breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “mini bar charges to credit card days later!”
Reviews.Author: realfitz
Reviews.Content: just wondering if anyone else was charged for 2 chocolate bars on their credit card two days later. Rang hotel and was told some people lie!! seriously, about 2 chocolate bars. Total refused to believe me and told me the finance department would have to investigate it!! and i could ring back. Calls cost more then there over priced chocolate! the hotel was clean, restaurant doesn't open on a Sunday and only serves fish but adjacent to street with a large selection of great cuisines. payed in advance with lastminute.com, only had city tax to pay when leaving, save your self a headache and tell them you don't have a credit card!

Reviews.Title: “Bed covered with bugs (100+ fruit flies); rooms near bar very noisy”
Reviews.Author: butterfly00
Reviews.Content: I was traveling for work and my meetings did not end until 1:30 a.m. When I arrived at my room, it was quite noisy from the bar and I called to complain. Nothing changed but I got ready for bed to try to get some sleep. When I walked over to the bed, it was covered with bugs - there were 50 fruit flies on the pillow alone. It was incredibly disgusting. I went to the reception desk to complain and they switched me to another room. However, instead of apologizing or trying to make it better in any way (free breakfast - anything!), they irritably told me that they were giving me another room and that should resolve the issue, what else do I want them to do. I of course checked out of the hotel the following morning, at which point they tried to charge me for the following night as well because I didn't give them 24 hours notice of cancellation! I told them moving rooms at 2 a.m. due to an insect infestation was my 24 hours notice, but it required a long conversation with the manager to get the extra night fee off my bill. They charged me for my "insect infested night" and every other item I had on my bill, even the five euro bottle of water - without any kind of concession given my experience. I guess they felt they had nothing to lose since obviously, I am never going back there again!

Reviews.Title: “little bit remote, very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: uksmiler2010
Reviews.Content: Ok so the rooms have not been decorated for over a decade, and yes its a bit of a hike if your heading into the centre of Amsterdam. If you get a room overlooking the water then you will forget the decore. However, my reason for writing this review is our departing airport taxi experience..... 42 euros for a 20 min trip! So if your looking for an airport taxi don't use the ones from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “nice enough hotel with helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: smileykate100
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights with a friend. We had booked the hotel through the 'Mystery Hotel' deal on Lastminute. The hotel is a five minute walk from the tram stop (trams 5 and 24) that go directly to the central station. Upon arrival at the hotel we were pleased to see that it was in a good area that was quiet and felt safe. The staff at reception were friendly and polite and gave us a map of the area etc when we checked in. Unfortunately we were sent to a room witha double bed instead of two singles as requested and the bed was unmade and beer cans were left out. However, after complaining we were moved to another room. the new room was fairly spacious but we did notice that it was VERY dusty and the decor was very outdated and old. I wouldnt say that the rooms were of 4 star standard (although I understand that rooms in Amsterdam can be v small and dingy so maybe it could be compared to those. At this point we just wanted to unpack our bags so we didnt bother to complain. all in all i would recommend the hotel but I wouldnt have been happy if we hadn't had a discount through lastminute.

Reviews.Title: “A good stay.”
Reviews.Author: CrazyKev
Reviews.Content: I got this at a special rate, so it made for a very good value stay. The position is great on the junction of 5 canals and it is about 5 minutes walk fro the Apolollaan stop on the number 5 and 24 trams from the centraal station. The rooms are a decent size and reasonably well finished. I had limited dealings with the staff but they seemed professional and friendly enough. The down side has to be the price of breakfast (which I didn't have) and the fact that you have to pay for internet access. They are restaurants and cafes within 10 minutes of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Calm, comfortable, canals...what more do you need?!”
Reviews.Author: LolloC
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal on a room for this hotel, so we weren't expecting anything more than a bed for the night. What a pleasant surprise-from the moment we waded into the lobby soaked from a rain shower, we were treated to a fabulously luxurious experience. The staff were friendly and welcoming. The room was much bigger than we'd expected from an Amsterdam hotel, with a bed that was very difficult to leave. The hotel is a pleasant 10 minute walk from Museumplein, or a 10 minute tram ride to Dam Square, so, while the hotel isn't at the heart of the action, it's close enough to have a great night out and then be able to get some sleep, unlike in some hotels in the city centre. If coming from Schipol airport using public transport, get the train to Station Zuid and the #5 tram (direction Station Centraal) to Apollolaan, quicker than going to Station Centraal and trying to find a tram from there.

Reviews.Title: “Too tall for the bed”
Reviews.Author: kwoodRochester
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in March. It has just changed ownership, so I thought the y were offering a great deal since it was off season and to drum up new business. Well you get what you pay for. The bargain was a room with a Murphy bed. Fine for a solo, but too small for two adults over 6 feet tall. The location is about a 15 minute tram ride to city center, which can be inconvienent after visiting teh sites and before dinner. It is a beautiful setting on teh canals, but no old world character or "coffee cafes' if that is part of your Amsterdam experience. I would stay here again (in a room with a real bed) if we were staying for an extended time on business. If you only have a night or two, stay closer to the city center

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel tucked away in suburban Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: GlobalOrbitz
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for my partner and I over Valentines weekend as a special "get me out of London" treat and have to say it was a great choice. Located a brisk 10 minutes walk from Museum Plein and about 25 minutes from central Amsterdam in what I would call suburbia I was at first quite hesitant as Wyndham had recently taken the property over. We discovered that there really is a lot do locally and some great restaurants, cafes and bakeries all a short stroll away. They have a lovely lobby with a gorgeous fire in winter which we really loved. Definitely worth it if you are looking for comfortable surroundings

HotelInfo.Name: Wyndham Apollo
HotelInfo.Address: Apollolaan 2, Amsterdam 1077 BA, The Netherlands
